docs.abstract: Huge incentive packages are a burden for taxpayers. Other cities should follow New York’s lead.
docs.snippet: Huge incentive packages are a burden for taxpayers. Other cities should follow New York’s lead.
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s an extraordinary moment. Amazon just said, “Goodbye, New York,” announcing that it was pulling out of its plans to open a headquarters in New York City, in exchange for which the city and state had promised as much as $3 billion in incentives.

headline.main: New York Doesn’t Need Amazon’s Sweetheart Deal
headline.print_headline: Better Off Without the Amazon Deal

docs.abstract: Labor groups aiming to organize a Staten Island warehouse were in talks with the company a day before it abandoned plans for a Queens headquarters.
docs.snippet: Labor groups aiming to organize a Staten Island warehouse were in talks with the company a day before it abandoned plans for a Queens headquarters.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Amazon announced Thursday that it was abandoning plans for an additional corporate headquarters in New York, no one was more surprised than the union leaders who were in talks with the company the day before.

headline.main: Amazon and New York Unions Had ‘Productive Meeting,’ Then Came a Shock
headline.print_headline: Amazon Quit Amid Efforts To Unionize In New York

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: AMERICAN FEDERATION OF LABOR-CONGRESS OF INDUSTRIAL ORGANIZATIONS

docs.abstract: Ruth Messinger, a former Manhattan borough president, says democracy has been ill served.
docs.snippet: Ruth Messinger, a former Manhattan borough president, says democracy has been ill served.

docs.abstract: Amazon might have been the center of a new tech ecosystem in Queens. Here’s what the city can do next.
docs.snippet: Amazon might have been the center of a new tech ecosystem in Queens. Here’s what the city can do next.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon’s decision on Feb. 14 to cancel its plans in New York City was actually the second time that New York missed its chance to host Amazon headquarters. The first time was in 1994, and what happened then informs what might happen next.

headline.main: Does New York Still Have a Future in Tech?

docs.abstract: Dow Chemical stopped making napalm for the military in 1969, just four years after it began. But the reputational damage haunted the company for decades.
docs.snippet: Dow Chemical stopped making napalm for the military in 1969, just four years after it began. But the reputational damage haunted the company for decades.
docs.lead_paragraph: Over the past few months, a fierce debate has erupted in Silicon Valley over whether large technology companies like Amazon, Google and Microsoft should join forces with the United States military, along with agencies like Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

headline.main: Why Napalm Is a Cautionary Tale for Tech Giants Pursuing Military Contracts
headline.print_headline: Why Napalm  Is a Cautionary Tale  For Tech Giants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The governor of New York has called Mr. Bezos and other Amazon executives to persuade them to resurrect their plan to build a campus in Long Island City.

docs.abstract: A court battle over trade secrets highlighted how the Big Three corporations’ new unit is unnerving major insurers in the field.
docs.snippet: A court battle over trade secrets highlighted how the Big Three corporations’ new unit is unnerving major insurers in the field.
docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group, the giant health insurance company, on Friday lost its case to prevent a former executive from working at the new health care venture formed by three powerful corporations, Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Loses Case to the Health Venture Begun by Amazon, Berkshire-Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth Loses Case  Against a Juggernaut Trio

docs.abstract: Amazon says it will offer more than a million deals, including discounts on Echo devices, kitchen appliances and more — and extend the sale by an extra six hours compared with last year.
docs.snippet: Amazon says it will offer more than a million deals, including discounts on Echo devices, kitchen appliances and more — and extend the sale by an extra six hours compared with last year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon has added an extra six hours to Prime Day, the company’s summer version of Cyber Monday. This year, Prime Day starts on July 16 at 3 p.m. Eastern Time and ends on July 17 at midnight. Amazon says it will offer more than a million deals.

headline.main: How to Make the Most of Amazon Prime Day 2018
